qas.question: A unified German Empire ended the balance of power in which congress?
At the end of the Napoleonic wars, Germany had established itself as what, in continental Europe?
Who remained the dominant world power at this time?
British involvement in European matters in the late 19th century was considered what?
The Crown Prince's marriage to whom was considered the most prominent of German-British royal liasons?

context: The creation of a unified German Empire ended the balance of power that had been created with the <a0_0>Congress of Vienna<a0_0/> after the end of the Napoleonic Wars. Germany had established itself as <a1_0>the main power<a1_0/> in continental Europe with the most powerful and professional army in the world.[citation needed] Although <a2_0>Great Britain<a2_0/> remained the dominant world power, British involvement in European affairs during the late 19th century was <a3_0>very limited<a3_0/>, allowing Germany to exercise great influence over the European mainland.[citation needed] Besides, the Crown Prince's marriage with <a4_0>the daughter of Queen Victoria<a4_0/> was only the most prominent of several German–British relationships.
